climbs.name: Summer lovin
climbs.fa: I belive Bob Kamps without the bolts

content.description: Start on the south east corner and work up just right of a left slanting seam/crack.  clip first bolt and move up left ( 5.8).  continue straight up wandering over multiple quartz knobs past 4 more bolts.  run out 25 feet to the chains on easier slabby rock.
content.protection: 5 draws, chains at top to rap south face.
content.location: 50 yards down hill from the needles parking lot.  South face start on east corner.

content.description: This route was surprisingly really good quality. It has some nice thin crack moves and some really good locks. It is short but on the whole time. It's quite thin and the lead would be a good one. I just TR after summer lovin as it looked pretty on and tricky pro. If leading be strong with your placements and don't skip any as it seemed to me there wasn't too many opportunities for good gear.
content.protection: Small cams/nuts. I didn't lead it so can't say for sure. Use the same Bolted anchor/chains as Summer Lovin
content.location: This is the face/thin crack system to the left of Summer Lovin.

content.description: South facing and 50 yards down hill from the pestering touristas.  70 foot spire, well bolted with 5 bolts (compared to the rest of the area)and chains to rap off of.
